arm_group.description: administration of 4% buffered lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the clinical efficacy of a buffered 4% lidocaine
      solution for incision and drainage.  Ninety patients will be examined clinically to
      determine a diagnosis of cellulitis or fluctuance.  The diagnosis will be confirmed by
      incision and drainage.  Patients will receive either 3.6 ml 4% lidocaine with 1:100,000
      epinephrine or 3.6 ml 4% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine buffered with 8.4% sodium
      bicarbonate.  Patients will rate pain prior to and throughout the procedure.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Buffered Lidocaine in Patients With Facial Swelling

detailed_description.textblock:
Incision and drainage of swellings is painful and anesthetic failure is common. One reason
      may be related to the lowered pH of inflamed tissue reducing the amount of the base form of
      anesthetic. A buffered anesthetic solution may result in more effective anesthesia than a
      non-buffered solution.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 years or older

          -  in good health (ASA classification I or II)

          -  able to give informed consent

          -  necrotic tooth with associated facial swelling

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  allergies to local anesthetics or sulfites

          -  history of significant medical problems (ASA classification III or greater)

          -  pregnancy

          -  inability to give informed consent

facility.name: The Ohio State University College of Dentistry

clinical_study.official_title: Anesthetic Efficacy of 4% Buffered Lidocaine in Emergency Patients With Facial Swelling.

overall_official.affiliation: The Ohio  State University College of Dentistry

primary_outcome.description: Patients will rate pain on a visual analog scale during needle insertion, placement, and solution deposition phases of the anesthetic injection(s).  Patients will also rate pain during the incision and dissection phases of the incision and drainage procedure.
primary_outcome.measure: pain measurement as assessed on a visual analog scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: during injection and incision and drainage on Day 0
